org.assertj.swing.fixture

Interface JTreeNodeFixture<S>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
    All Superinterfaces:
    ItemFixture<S>, MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JTreePathFixture, JTreeRowFixture

    public interface JTreeNodeFixture<S>
extends ItemFixture<S>
    Supports functional testing of single nodes in JTrees
    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      S collapse()
      Simulates a user collapsing this fixture's tree node.
      S expand()
      Simulates a user expanding this fixture's tree node.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.assertj.swing.fixture.ItemFixture

        drag, drop, select, showPopupMenu, value

      • Methods inherited from interface org.assertj.swing.fixture.MouseInputSimulationFixture

        click, click, click, doubleClick, rightClick

    • Method Detail

      • expand

        @Nonnull
S expand()
        Simulates a user expanding this fixture's tree node.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the JTree is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - if the JTree is not showing on the screen.
        ActionFailedException - if this method fails to expand the row.

      • collapse

        @Nonnull
S collapse()
        Simulates a user collapsing this fixture's tree node.
        Returns:
        this fixture.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the JTree is disabled.
        IllegalStateException - if the JTree is not showing on the screen.
        ActionFailedException - if this method fails to collapse the row.
